boardgame.name: Ports of Europe: Rotterdam
Rotterdam
boardgame.description:
The Harbour of Rotterdam
At least 370 million tons of goods are being processed in the Rotterdam Harbour. From South America all sorts of exotic fruits are delivered to the Merwehaven and are being processed to all kinds of fruit juices. The Vulcaanhaven on the edge of Vlaardingen is specially equipped for the transfer or processing of grains from North America. Petroleum comes from the Middle East in large quantities to be transferred in gasoline and chemical products in the raffinaries in the Botlek. Mega carriers transport millions of containers from Asia with all kinds of products to the European market. The infrastructure around the Eemhaven and Waalhaven guarantee a quick transport to Europe.

Harbour Tycoon
This harbour game gives you the opportunity to be an entrepreneur transporting goods from all parts of the world with ships to the main port Rotterdam. The goods are processed in the different harbours to real products. But it can be quite busy in the harbour! Will you succeed in leading your ships to the right harbours and deliver products like bread, jam, gasoline and clothing to the European market in time? Maybe you will be the new Harbour Tycoon of Rotterdam!

Family game and expansion
The board game Rotterdam is easy to understand, but has an exciting game play with all the dynamics of the harbour in it. It can be played from 8 years and up. The players will enjoy the basic elements of the harbour: loading cargo, navigating your ships, transfer goods in the harbours and process the goods to products for the European market. Masters of Trade is the expansion to Rotterdam, which brings the economy to the game, introducing factories, more control and new markets.

Sequel
Rotterdam was the first game in the Ports of Europe series, being followed by Ports of Europe: Antwerpen in 2010.

Expanded by Masters of Trade.

boardgame.name: De Ontembare Stad: Het Verraad
boardgame.description:
Het Verraad (Treason) is the first expansion to the game De Ontembare Stad (The Indomitable Citadel)

The tactical and strategic alternatives of Treason have grown significantly in comparison to the original "De Ontembare Stad". Luck is just a small factor in the game. The character of the Dark Master is an important new feature in the game, in fact introducing an extra player in the game. Each player becomes a chance to support the dark side or the good side. Investing in dark power increases the attractiveness of the Dark Master. New playing pieces as Watchtowers allow players to defend themselves against the attacks of the Dark Master. Giving money to the church improves the power of the good forces and gives some protection against the Dark forces. New castle cards and income blocks are a valuable new asset to the game, because the players are able to monitor their income in each category.

As the Citadel is prosperous and the number of citizens grows, rumor has it that a dark character will come inside the Citadel's walls. The Dark Master must be countered by the five Grand Masters to save The Citadel from destruction. But which of the Grand Masters are strong enough to withstand the attraction of the dark side. Since each one of them would like to increase their influence in the Citadel, one or more traitors are more likely to reveal their real character when the game draws to a thrilling finale.

boardgame.name: The Game of Society
boardgame.description: A pretty complicated game considering it was produced in 1874. The Game of Society is written on 55 cards (22 red (virtues), 13 black (vices) and 20 green (neutral) in 4 letters A B C D which stand for Angles, Britons, Celts and Danes the principle components of the Anglo-Saxon race. 2,4, or 6 can play. If played in teams the teams are either 2 or 3 person teams. Deal 7 cards to each player. The top card, called the Providence is then turned over. This determines trumps for that round. if the trump does not suit the person to the left of the dealer that person may say "NOLO" in which case two more cards are dealt to each player and a second Providence card is turned over which must remain trumps for the round, if the card does suit the player he calls "VOLO" and the hand begins. The cards have names on them that relate to their rank in the suit. Names like Benevolence, Christian, Industry, Press, Villain, Education, Intemperance, Virtues, Man in Home, Woman in home, Debt etc. These cards have value which determines which card wins the trick. Some cards reduce the value of a trick and therefore wind up resulting in a negative valued trick. Virtue cards are positive and vice cards are negatively valued, neutrals are just that and are worth zero. Object is to be the first to get to 7 points.

boardgame.name: Schley at Santiago Bay
boardgame.description:
From an article in "The Games We Played" by Margaret Hofer.

Schley at Santiago Bay is one of a series of patriotic games inspired by the Spanish-American War. 'Schley at Santiago Bay' celebrated war hero Winfield Scott Schley while teaching players facts about the recent war. Schley, hardly a household name today, was the U.S. Navy commodore in command of the Flying Squadron during the victorious battle at Santiago. An investigation conducted 2 years after the publication of the game found Schley guilty of negligence and misconduct during the battle.

boardgame.name: Nine Inning Classic
boardgame.description:
Nine Inning Classic is a baseball board game using dice, player cards and charts to determine the results of every play.

Players will pitch, hit, field and run as they did in real life. You make all the strategy calls. Make the line ups, decide when to pinch hit, steal, bunt, hit and run, bring the infield in to cut down the runner at home, and more.

Nine Inning Classic plays fast and has the feel and excitement of real baseball!

With Nine Inning Classic, you can play with any player that ever played baseball. With other games, you need to buy the teams you want to play with, but with Nine Inning Classic, you can make your own player cards. Just enter the player statistics on your computer and the cards are created almost automatically.

Special Features of Nine Inning Classic

You can make your own player cards.



On-line user group where you can get free user-made cards, get game enhancements, and chat about the game.



Unique, optional strategy cards you can play during the game, adding real fun and gamesmanship.



Lots of rare plays such as bad calls, hit batters and much more.
